subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... Not really.  Consider French u and English u ; same glyphs, different sounds.  Shavian and QS (and IPA) have characters tied more tightly to particular
messageBody:
amd64_hacker scripsit:

> It seems to me that unless the glyphs and sound of two characters are
> identical they are not the same letter.

Not really. Consider French "u" and English "u"; same glyphs, different
sounds. Shavian and QS (and IPA) have characters tied more tightly
to particular sounds, so it seems that the sound should be relevant,
but it really isn't.

--
In politics, obedience and support John Cowan <cowan@...>
are the same thing. --Hannah Arendt http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
